page.title: 07UNEMPLOYMENT-SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: We thought that the most serious social concern of 1985 was unemployment 118,803 people alone in Birmingham are without a job.1590 of them in Ladywood We decided to look at one the 118,803 and find out his hopes and fears for the future.We will call the person John for convenience. John has been unemployed for 3 years. He had been sacked from his job as a Telephone Operator.He spends his days cooking,cleaning and washing.He never visits the Job Centre but looks in the newspaper for work instead. His biggest problem is that he has a wife and three children.His hopes for the future in his own words are "to get another job or win the pools or something",but that is very unlikely and his job prospects are very gloomy. by A.RICE and M.MESSAM
